summary: Study tasks app with Weekly/Daily tabs and progress bars; current focus is fixing Daily tab progress bar rendering using the existing component.
architectural_notes: Reuse the existing progress bar component for Daily view; do not modify the Weekly progress bar.
Daily progress bar render conditions: only when Daily tab is active and dailyTasks.length > 0; compute progress from Daily tasks only.

UI placement constraint: render directly under 'Your Daily Study Tasks' heading and above the daily task list with the same spacing as the weekly progress bar; avoid new containers and avoid global CSS changes.
known_issues: Daily progress bar UI is not rendering/visible in the Daily tab even though daily progress logic exists.

existing_features.title: In `frontend/src/pages/StudyPlannerPage.tsx`, render the existing Study Planner progress bar UI in the Daily view so it is visible when the Daily tab is active, using the same progress bar component and styling currently used for the Weekly progress bar.

Place the Daily progress bar exactly under the "Your Daily Study Tasks" heading and above the daily task list, using the same spacing/margins as the Weekly progress bar placement, without moving or restructuring any other UI elements.

Compute and display the Daily progress percentage using Daily tasks only (completed daily tasks / total daily tasks Ã— 100), and apply the visibility rules: hide the Daily progress bar when there are 0 daily tasks; show the progress bar (including percentage) when there is at least 1 daily task.

If the Daily progress bar still does not render after binding it to the Daily tab state, add targeted console logging (no UI changes) in `StudyPlannerPage.tsx` to log the render condition inputs (currentView, daily total, daily completed, computed percent) so the condition can be verified in the browser console.

new_feature_requests.summary: Fix: render existing progress bar in Daily tab under 'Your Daily Study Tasks' heading; show only when Daily tab active; compute using daily tasks only; hide when no daily tasks
